title: 107_hr2799
content: The Act titled "Medicare Pharmacist Services Coverage Act of 2001" allows for Medicare coverage of pharmacist services. The Medicare Pharmacist Services Coverage Act of 2001 amends the Social Security Act to include pharmacist services under Medicare coverage. The Medicare Pharmacist Services Coverage Act of 2001 includes pharmacist services under Medicare coverage. The Medicare Pharmacist Services Coverage Act of 2001 defines pharmacist services as drug therapy management services provided by a pharmacist in accordance with State law. Payment for these services is addressed in Section 1833(a)(1) of the Social Security Act. The Medicare Pharmacist Services Coverage Act of 2001 defines pharmacist services as drug therapy management services provided by a pharmacist in accordance with State law. Payment for these services is addressed in Section 1833(a)(1) of the Social Security Act. Additionally, a fee schedule for pharmacist services is established under Section 1834(n) of the Act, with payments set at 80 percent of the lesser of the actual charge or the established amount. The Secretary will develop a relative value scale and fee schedules for pharmacist services payment under Medicare, considering differences in various factors. The Secretary will consult with national organizations representing pharmacists and pharmacies to develop fee schedules for pharmacist services under Medicare, considering factors like time required, level of risk, and health status of individuals. The Secretary will pay 80 percent of the fee schedule amount for pharmacist services provided before its implementation. A report to Congress on fee schedules for pharmacist services under Medicare will be submitted within 3 years of the Act's enactment. The amendments made by this section apply to services under part B of the Medicare program starting from January 1, 2002.
